|coordinates_type = region:US_type:city |latd = 37|latm = 13|lats = 29|latNS = N |longd = 87|longm = 40|longs = 19|longEW = W <!-- Area/postal codes & others --> |postal_code_type = [[ZIP code]]s 489364<ref>{{gnis|489364}}</ref> |website = |footnotes = }} '''Charleston''' is an [[unincorporated area|unincorporated community]] in southwestern [[Hopkins County, Kentucky|Hopkins County]], [[Kentucky]], [[United States]]. According to legend, it was named for "Free Charles" (last name unknown), a former [[slavery|slave]], who had owned a [[tavern]] there. A Charleston post office was in operation from 1855 to 1909.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://books.google.com/books?id=3Lac2FUSj_oC&lpg=PA49&dq=cannon%20ky&pg=PA56#v=onepage&q=cannon%20ky&f=false | title=Kentucky Place Names | publisher=University Press of Kentucky | date=1987 | accessdate=2013-04-28 | author=Rennick, Robert M. | pages=56}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} {{Hopkins County, Kentucky}} [[Category:Unincorporated communities in Kentucky]] [[Category:Populated places in Hopkins County, Kentucky]] {{Kentucky-geo-stub}}
